summaries.brief_summary: OCaml security pages launched, Zulip chat integration added, web development packages expanded, and Dune 3.20.2 released
summaries.new_features_summary: New security disclosure framework, Zulip chat integration, and three new web development packages (vif, ocaml-h1, httpcats)
summaries.new_features:
- **OCaml Security Team pages** introduced with comprehensive security disclosure process, vulnerability reporting procedures, and team member information ([#3300](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3300))
- **Zulip chat integration** added to community page with dedicated icon and link to caml.zulipchat.com ([#3301](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3301))
- **Web development packages** expanded with vif (framework), ocaml-h1 (HTTP server), and httpcats (HTTP client) in the "Is OCaml Yet?" web section ([#3311](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3311))
- **Dune 3.20.2 release** changelog published with fixes for jsoo separate compilation, runtest-js dependencies, cram test cleanup, and Cygwin bootstrap ([#3302](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3302))
- **Documentation cleanup** removing outdated OCaml 5 compatibility note from HACKING.md ([#3303](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3303))
summaries.activity_summary: Major Dune Package Management migration under review, planet blog scraping fixes, and governance page maintenance discussions ongoing
summaries.activity:
- **Dune Package Management migration** continues with comprehensive PR from [sabine](https://github.com/sabine) addressing opam workflow support, performance optimization, and daily smoke testing ([#3281](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3281))
- **Planet blog scraping** restored for robur.coop feeds by [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) after automation issues ([#3263](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3263))
- **Backstage OCaml** content categorization proposal by [sabine](https://github.com/sabine) to separate experimental communications from main changelog ([#3278](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3278))
- **Nushell support** proposed for opam environment setup by [@Timmmm](https://github.com/Timmmm) targeting Windows users ([#3307](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3307))
- **Automated blog content** successfully scraped and merged including OCaml Weekly News, Tarides tutorials, and Jonludlam technical posts ([#3297](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3297), [#3298](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3298), [#3308](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3308), [#3313](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3313))
summaries.discussions_summary: Security team collaboration for new pages, governance structure improvements, and development environment setup challenges
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Security Team coordination** between [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) and [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) for implementing security pages with proper navigation and content structure ([#3299](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3299))
- **Governance page modernization** debated by [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) regarding outdated mailing lists from 2016-2020 and potential GitHub Issues replacement ([#3306](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3306))
- **Development environment troubleshooting** by [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) reporting devcontainer build failures and incompatible lsp/yojson versions ([#3304](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3304))
- **Profiling tutorial updates** ongoing discussion between [@patrick-nicodemus](https://github.com/patrick-nicodemus) and [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) about replacing gprof with perf documentation ([#1713](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/1713))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on security infrastructure, community platform integration, and automated content management systems
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Security-first approach** with formal disclosure processes and dedicated team structure reflecting growing enterprise adoption needs
- **Community platform diversification** expanding beyond traditional channels to include modern chat platforms like Zulip alongside Matrix
- **Package ecosystem documentation** actively maintained through "Is OCaml Yet?" sections showing growing web development capabilities
- **Automated content workflows** increasingly sophisticated with platform release scraping, blog aggregation, and changelog generation
- **Development environment modernization** ongoing migration to Dune Package Management and improved contributor tooling
summaries.contributors_summary: Six core maintainers driving security infrastructure, community features, and automated content management improvements
summaries.contributors:
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) initiated OCaml Security Team pages and coordinated security infrastructure implementation ([#3299](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3299))
- [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) implemented security pages, resolved blog scraping issues for robur.coop feeds, and provided technical guidance across multiple PRs ([#3300](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3300), [#3263](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3263))
- [sabine](https://github.com/sabine) continued major Dune Package Management migration work and proposed Backstage OCaml content reorganization ([#3281](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3281), [#3278](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3278))
- [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) contributed Zulip chat integration, documentation cleanup, identified governance page issues, and reported development environment problems ([#3301](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3301), [#3303](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3303), [#3306](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3306), [#3304](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3304))
- [Calascibetta Romain](https://github.com/dinosaure) added three web development packages to expand ecosystem documentation ([#3311](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3311))
- [@Timmmm](https://github.com/Timmmm) proposed nushell support for opam environment setup to improve Windows developer experience ([#3307](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3307))

summaries.brief_summary: Content updates and documentation improvements across OCaml Planet, changelog releases, and contributor guidelines.

summaries.brief_summary: Blog scraping fixes, Dune 3.20.0 release documentation, and authentication package cleanup
summaries.new_features_summary: Fixed blog scraping workflows and improved blog filtering debug output
summaries.new_features:
- **Scraping workflow isolation** by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) separating branch names for planet scraping and changelog scraping to prevent conflicts ([#3269](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3269))
- **Enhanced blog scraping debug output** with more detailed logging in the blog filtering system to help diagnose scraping issues ([fad3f10](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/fad3f10c004620e9b5432d6379fc142b9c7f00c0))
- **Updated authentication package documentation** by [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) removing deprecated `u2f` package and adding description for passkey authentication with `webauthn` ([#3258](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3258))
summaries.activity_summary: Blog content aggregation restored and Dune 3.20.0 release documentation added
summaries.activity:
- **Blog content restoration** with [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) fixing the filtering regression that prevented Robur blog posts from appearing ([#3266](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3266), [#3263](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3263))
- **Release documentation** by [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) adding the complete changelog for Dune 3.20.0 with detailed feature descriptions and improvements ([#3265](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3265))
- **OCaml-eglot announcement** with [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) finalizing the changelog entry for the new Emacs package after review by [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) ([#3080](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3080))
- **Automated content aggregation** with multiple successful scraping runs bringing in blog posts from Robur, Tarides, Anil Madhavapeddy, and OCaml Weekly News ([#3270](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3270), [#3271](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3271), [#3262](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3262))
summaries.discussions_summary: Technical discussions around scraping system reliability and package management transitions
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Blog scraping reliability** discussion initiated by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) identifying conflicts between concurrent scraping workflows, leading to collaborative debugging with [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) and implementation of branch separation ([#3263](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3263), [#3267](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3267))
- **Authentication package evolution** discussion with [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) explaining the deprecation of `u2f` package and transition to modern `webauthn` for passkey authentication ([#3258](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3258))
- **Dune package management transition** ongoing technical discussions around the stalled migration to Dune package management, with [Bozhidar Batsov](https://github.com/bbatsov) raising questions about long-term OCaml-eglot development plans ([#3132](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3132), [#3080](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3080))
summaries.trends_summary: Increased focus on infrastructure reliability and content aggregation improvements
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Infrastructure reliability** emphasis with proactive identification and resolution of blog scraping conflicts, showing commitment to maintaining the Planet OCaml aggregation system
- **Automated content integration** improvements with multiple successful blog post aggregations bringing diverse OCaml community content to the website
- **Package ecosystem maintenance** with cleanup of deprecated packages and improved documentation for modern authentication solutions
- **Release documentation discipline** with timely addition of comprehensive changelogs for major releases like Dune 3.20.0
summaries.contributors_summary: Five contributors made code and documentation improvements with collaborative debugging
summaries.contributors:
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) reported blog scraping issues ([#3263](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3263)), proposed and implemented workflow separation fixes ([#3269](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3269)), and provided detailed technical analysis of scraping conflicts
- [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) investigated blog scraping failures, implemented filtering fixes ([#3266](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3266)), opened tracking issue for broader filtering regression ([#3267](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3267)), and provided technical debugging support
- [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) cleaned up authentication package documentation by removing deprecated `u2f` package and enhancing `webauthn` descriptions for modern passkey authentication ([#3258](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3258))
- [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) contributed comprehensive Dune 3.20.0 release documentation with detailed changelog ([#3265](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3265))
- [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) finalized OCaml-eglot changelog announcement after collaborating with [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) on content review ([#3080](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3080))

summaries.brief_summary: Enhanced changelog automation with improved release scraper and added hundreds of historical OCaml platform release announcements.
summaries.new_features_summary: Improved changelog scraper can now automatically generate PR suggestions for missing OCaml platform releases from GitHub.
summaries.new_features:
- **Enhanced changelog scraper automation** with ability to generate PR suggestions for missing OCaml platform releases from GitHub projects, including automated file generation and improved metadata tracking ([8f877f5f1](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/8f877f5f1a67fe45c00a319827d730137fc3ecc8))
- **Extended changelog data model** with new `unstable`, `ignore`, and `github_release_tags` fields to better track release metadata and filter unwanted entries ([8f877f5f1](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/8f877f5f1a67fe45c00a319827d730137fc3ecc8))
- **GitHub Actions workflow updates** to Node.js 24 with actions/checkout v5 upgrade across all CI workflows ([f5a0f482](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/f5a0f482da141f55e0f7c0905d914870f69e75b1))
summaries.activity_summary: Intensive changelog maintenance with over 6,000 lines of historical OCaml platform release announcements restored and organized.
summaries.activity:
- **Historical release announcements restoration** by [sabine](https://github.com/sabine) including comprehensive coverage of OCaml compiler alpha/beta/RC releases, platform tools releases, and opam releases spanning multiple years ([#3226](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3226), [#3252](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3252), [#3253](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3253))
- **Platform tool release coverage** additions including missing releases for merlin, ocaml-lsp-server, ppxlib, ocamlformat, ocp-indent, odoc, utop, and opam-publish with proper metadata ([#3250](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3250), [#3251](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3251), [#3248](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3248), [#3249](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3249))
- **Content organization improvements** with infrastructure announcements moved from releases to posts section and changelog title corrections ([#3254](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3254), [#3255](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3255), [#3256](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3256), [#3245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3245))
- **Community blog content expansion** with new OCaml planet posts and automated content scraping via GitHub Actions ([#3257](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3257), [#3261](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3261))
- **Package documentation updates** including removal of non-existent auth package and enhanced webauthn package description ([#3258](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3258))
- **Release automation enhancements** with GitHub release tags added to alpha/beta releases to ensure proper recognition by scraper workflows ([#3246](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3246))
summaries.trends_summary: Strong focus on historical preservation and automation improvements for changelog maintenance workflows.
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Historical documentation preservation** with systematic restoration of previously removed alpha/beta/RC release announcements to ensure comprehensive OCaml development timeline coverage
- **Automated release tracking** with enhanced scraping tools that can automatically detect missing releases from GitHub and generate structured changelog entries
- **Content curation automation** with improved workflows for automatically scraping and organizing OCaml community blog posts and videos from multiple sources
- **Metadata standardization** across release announcements with consistent tagging, GitHub release mapping, and filtering capabilities for stable vs unstable releases
summaries.contributors_summary: sabine led comprehensive changelog maintenance work while aguluman and yawaramin contributed community content additions.
summaries.contributors:
- [sabine](https://github.com/sabine) implemented the enhanced changelog scraper automation system ([#3217](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3217)), restored thousands of historical release announcements ([#3226](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3226)), added comprehensive missing releases for OCaml platform tools ([#3250](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3250), [#3251](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3251), [#3248](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3248), [#3249](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3249), [#3252](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3252), [#3253](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3253)), and performed extensive content organization and cleanup ([#3254](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3254), [#3255](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3255), [#3256](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3256), [#3245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3245), [#3246](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3246))
- [Chukwuma Akunyili](https://github.com/aguluman) added new OCaml-focused blog source to planet sources and contributed Azure deployment blog entry ([#3260](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3260), [#3259](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3259))
- [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) removed non-existent auth package and improved webauthn package documentation ([#3258](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3258))
- [@mt_caret](https://github.com/mt-caret) initiated internationalization work for tutorial documentation with draft PR covering structural changes ([#3238](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3238))
- [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) automated GitHub Actions dependency update to actions/checkout v5 ([#3244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3244))
- GitHub Actions automation contributed regular content scraping for blog posts and videos ([#3257](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3257), [#3261](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3261))

summaries.brief_summary: Content additions including new Cambridge CS book, OCaml blog posts, and planet source improvements

summaries.activity_summary: Website content updates through automated scraping and community contributions focused on educational resources
summaries.activity:

summaries.discussions_summary: Windows installation issue reported for opam/utop compilation problems

summaries.brief_summary: Added opam 2.4.0 and 2.4.1 release documentation, automated content curation via scrapers, and resolved API docs memory issue

summaries.new_features:

- **Opam 2.4.1 release changelog** by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) documenting the latest patch release with bug fixes and improvements ([#3228](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3228))

summaries.activity_summary: Resolved memory usage issue in API documentation, reverted alpha/beta changelog removals, and maintained content freshness through automated blog post scraping
summaries.activity:
- **Memory performance improvement** in API documentation pages resolved by [Christopher Fujino](https://github.com/christopherfujino) with memory usage dropping from 600+ MB to ~57 MB on large package documentation ([#3150](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3150))
- **Release changelog restoration** by [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) reverting previous removal of alpha and beta release announcements, with plans to split content between stable OCaml Changelog and experimental Backstage OCaml sections ([#3226](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3226))
- **Automated content curation** via daily scraper operations maintained fresh blog posts and video content from OCaml community sources ([#3227](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3227), [#3229](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3229), [#3230](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3230), [#3231](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3231))

summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Package manager documentation priority** with both opam 2.4.0 and 2.4.1 release announcements receiving dedicated changelog entries and detailed upgrade instructions
- **Website performance optimization** addressing memory consumption issues in documentation pages to improve user experience on large API reference pages
- **Content workflow automation** through regular scraping operations ensuring fresh community content appears consistently on the website
summaries.contributors_summary: Three contributors provided opam documentation, website performance fixes, and content management improvements
summaries.contributors:

- [Christopher Fujino](https://github.com/christopherfujino) reported and confirmed resolution of memory usage issues in API documentation pages, testing the fix and providing detailed feedback on performance improvements ([#3150](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3150))

summaries.brief_summary: Major infrastructure improvements with automated changelog scraping, content updates, and CI optimizations for better maintenance workflows
summaries.new_features_summary: New automated changelog scraper, improved linting configuration, and enhanced content management tools
summaries.new_features:
- Automated **changelog scraper** for OCaml Platform releases with GitHub Actions workflow ([#2949](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2949), [#3217](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3217))
- Enhanced **changelog scraping system** that can automatically open PRs for missing platform releases from GitHub repositories ([#3217](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3217))
- New **GitHub Actions workflow** for daily changelog scraping with automated PR creation ([scrape_changelog.yml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/b74a1c3fa244fd22fe96f3814e5fa9ab755e797d))
- Improved **linting configuration** that excludes auto-generated planet and changelog content from markdown linting ([#3222](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3222))
- **Scraper filename fixes** and GA error prevention for more reliable automation ([#3218](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3218), [#3219](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3219), [#3220](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3220))
- Added **changelog entries** for historical platform releases including opam 2.4.0 ([#3223](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3223))
- Comprehensive **documentation fix** for opam switch creation behavior clarification ([#3213](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3213))
- Major **package documentation upgrade** using odoc 3 features with improved sidebar, breadcrumbs, and source code pages ([#3124](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3124))
summaries.activity_summary: Infrastructure automation improvements, documentation enhancements, and ongoing community content discussions
summaries.activity:
- **Automated scraping infrastructure** by [sabine](https://github.com/sabine) with comprehensive updates to the changelog scraper system enabling automatic PR creation for missing OCaml Platform releases ([#3217](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3217), [#3216](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3216))
- **CI system improvements** by [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) including fixes for planet scraping, GA error prevention, and enhanced linting exclusions ([#3218](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3218), [#3219](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3219), [#3220](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3220), [#3222](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3222))
- **Package documentation deployment** by [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) completing the major upgrade to odoc 3 with enhanced features for package documentation area ([#3124](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3124))
- **Regular content updates** through automated scrapers adding new blog posts and videos to the OCaml Planet ([#3215](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3215), [#3221](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3221), [#3224](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3224), [#3225](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3225))
- **Documentation clarifications** by [sabine](https://github.com/sabine) addressing user confusion about opam switch creation behavior ([#3213](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3213))
- **Release documentation** by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) adding changelog for opam 2.4.0 with proper organization ([#3223](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3223))
summaries.discussions_summary: Community discussions on authentication security practices and memory optimization outcomes

summaries.trends_summary: Trend toward automated infrastructure maintenance with improved CI workflows and community content management

- **Documentation quality improvements** through automated tools and enhanced user experience with odoc 3 features

- **Community content management** with regular automated updates to OCaml Planet and better content organization

summaries.brief_summary: Infrastructure improvements, tutorial clarification, and planet source additions with automated content scraping
summaries.new_features_summary: Infrastructure improvements: Alpine upgrade, build system modernization, and dependency management updates
summaries.new_features:
- **Build system modernization** from dune commands to make-based workflow in CI/CD pipelines ([#3179](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3179))
- **Alpine Linux upgrade** from version 3.19 to 3.21 in Docker containers for improved compatibility ([#3180](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3180))
- **River dependency management** simplified by removing pinned fork and using standard river package ([#3178](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3178))

- **Planet feed integration** restored after fixing Syndic usage in RSS feed generation ([#3190](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3190))

summaries.discussions_summary: Community feedback on documentation accuracy and tooling alternatives, with ongoing discussions about OCaml Platform scope.
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Opam switch behavior clarification** requested by [Christoffer Ekeroth](https://github.com/chreke) pointing out discrepancies between documentation and actual opam behavior for plain name switches ([#3143](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3143))
- **RSS feed link corrections** reported by [Riku Silvola](https://github.com/rikusilvola) identifying broken changelog release links, resulting from partial reverts of previous changes ([#3136](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3136))
- **Topiary formatter integration** discussion ongoing with community members debating the scope of OCaml Platform documentation versus alternative tools ([#3097](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3097))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on infrastructure reliability and comprehensive documentation of the OCaml ecosystem's tooling landscape.
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Infrastructure documentation emphasis** with comprehensive coverage of OCaml's CI/CD pipeline and supporting services to help community members understand the ecosystem's technical foundation
- **Build system modernization** continuing with Dune package management adoption efforts and portable lock directory features addressing cross-platform development challenges
- **User experience improvements** through analytics integration (PostHog heatmaps) and documentation accuracy fixes based on community feedback
summaries.contributors_summary: Eight contributors submitted code changes, documentation improvements, and bug fixes across infrastructure and content areas.
summaries.contributors:
- [sabine](https://github.com/sabine) led infrastructure improvements with PostHog analytics integration ([#3141](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3141)), comprehensive OCaml Infrastructure documentation ([#3107](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3107)), markdown linting configuration ([#3139](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3139)), dependency management ([#3131](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3131), [#3134](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3134)), and extensive work on Dune package management transition ([#3132](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3132))
- [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) maintained build workflows by updating to OCaml 5.2.0 for scraping ([#3137](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3137)), removing problematic link checking ([#3140](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3140)), and completing the long-standing CEA description update ([#2839](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2839))
- [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) published educational content about Dune's portable lock directories feature ([#3113](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3113))
- [Sébastien Hinderer](https://github.com/shindere) contributed documentation fixes for compiler release notes ([#3133](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3133))
- [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) improved Docker build reliability with opam backup mirror support ([#3130](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3130))
- [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) published Dune 3.19.0 release announcement ([#3129](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3129))
- [FengTDI](https://github.com/zlh20040308) enhanced tutorial content with tree_of_string implementation ([#3135](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3135))
- [Christoffer Ekeroth](https://github.com/chreke) provided valuable feedback on opam documentation accuracy ([#3143](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3143))
- [Riku Silvola](https://github.com/rikusilvola) identified and reported RSS feed link issues ([#3136](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3136))

summaries.brief_summary: Added OCaml Planet post filtering, restored classic OCaml book, updated dependencies, and continued odoc 3 documentation improvements
summaries.new_features_summary: OCaml Planet post ignoring capability and improved blog scraping with only_ocaml default change
summaries.new_features:
- **OCaml Planet post filtering** feature allows excluding scraped posts with an `ignore` flag in post metadata, preventing unwanted posts from appearing in Planet feed [#3118](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3118)
- Changed **default blog scraping behavior** to only import OCaml-relevant posts by setting `only_ocaml` default to `true`, making explicit OCaml filtering the standard approach [#3118](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3118)
- **Enhanced blog post processing** now filters out posts marked with `ignore: true` in metadata during the generation process, improving Planet content curation
- Added **Didier Rémy's "U^3 OCaml" course book** from 2001 to the books section after resolving file path issues [#3111](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3111)
- **Markdown linting improvements** with updated configuration format and line length check settings for better documentation quality [#3114](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3114), [#3119](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3119)
summaries.activity_summary: Major Planet blog management cleanup, dependency updates, and ongoing odoc 3 documentation system development
summaries.activity:
- **Planet blog content management** by [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) including removal of Ryan Gibb's blog from Planet sources and filtering out numerous off-topic posts from Anil Madhavapeddy's blog to focus on OCaml-relevant content ([#3118](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3118))
- **Ongoing documentation modernization** by [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) with continued work on odoc 3 integration for improved package documentation with global sidebars, better breadcrumbs, and source code pages ([#3124](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3124), [#3123](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3123))
- **Infrastructure documentation** additions by [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) with new page about OCaml Infrastructure and Dune 3.19.0 release announcement ([#3107](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3107), [#3129](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3129))
- **GitHub Actions dependency updates** by dependabot including DavidAnson/markdownlint-cli2-action from v19 to v20 and tj-actions/changed-files from v45 to v46 ([#3115](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3115), [#3116](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3116))
- **Analytics transition** by [Mark Telvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) replacing Plausible with PostHog for website analytics ([#3101](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3101))
- **Regular automated content updates** through scraper bringing in new OCaml blog posts and videos from the community ([#3117](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3117), [#3121](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3121), [#3126](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3126), [#3128](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3128))
summaries.discussions_summary: Discussions about OCaml Planet curation, Topiary formatter inclusion, and Planet RSS feed content optimization
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **OCaml Planet curation strategy** discussed in [#3120](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3120) by [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) questioning whether full post bodies are needed since Planet only shows blurbs and links to originals
- **Topiary formatter inclusion debate** in [#3097](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3097) by [@toastal](https://github.com/toastal) about adding Topiary as alternative to OCamlFormat, with ongoing discussion about platform tool policies
- **Planet RSS optimization** by [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) in [#3125](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3125) proposing to stop republishing full post content in RSS feeds
- **Dune package management testing** explored by [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) in [#3127](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3127) with GitHub Actions workflow for dune pkg validation
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on content curation and quality for OCaml Planet, modernization of documentation infrastructure, and improved automation
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Content curation emphasis** with new tools and policies for filtering OCaml Planet posts, ensuring higher relevance and quality of aggregated content
- **Documentation system modernization** moving toward odoc 3 with enhanced features like global sidebars and source code integration
- **Infrastructure documentation** improvements making OCaml ecosystem tools and processes more accessible to contributors
- **Automated maintenance workflows** with regular dependency updates and content scraping ensuring site freshness
summaries.contributors_summary: Active contributions from core maintainers focusing on content management, documentation systems, and site infrastructure
summaries.contributors:
- [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) led **OCaml Planet management** implementing post filtering capabilities, cleaning up blog sources, adding OCaml infrastructure documentation, and configuring markdown linting ([#3118](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3118), [#3107](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3107), [#3119](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3119))
- [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) continued **odoc 3 integration work** with substantial changes to package documentation system including new UI components and backend integration ([#3124](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3124), [#3123](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3123))
- [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) contributed **Planet optimization proposals** questioning post body storage needs and RSS content republishing practices ([#3120](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3120), [#3125](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3125))
- [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) provided **project maintenance** including file attribute updates and reviewing automated content additions ([#3122](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3122))
- [Bozhidar Batsov](https://github.com/bbatsov) fixed **markdown linting configuration** resolving format issues that were preventing proper linting enforcement ([#3114](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3114))
- [Mark Telvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) implemented **analytics platform migration** from Plausible to PostHog with community discussion about infrastructure choices ([#3101](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3101))
- [@lukstafi](https://github.com/lukstafi) restored **historical OCaml book** by reverting previous removal of Didier Rémy's course materials ([#3111](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3111))
- [@maiste](https://github.com/maiste) contributed **Dune 3.19.0 release announcement** providing community updates on build tool improvements ([#3129](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3129))
- [@gridbugs](https://github.com/gridbugs) added **technical content** about portable lock directories in Dune ([#3113](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/pull/3113))

summaries.brief_summary: Website infrastructure improvements with markdown linting, academic institution display enhancements, and extensive blog content additions
summaries.new_features_summary: New markdown linting workflow, enhanced academic institution course display, and tutorial syntax fixes
